data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
Which compound has the highest yield based on H3BO3?
Is the crystal system of compound 4 monoclinic?
What is the space group of compound 2?
Does compound 3 have a higher density than compound 4?
What is the coordination environment of the K+ ion in compound 4?
data.answer: K(1) is six-coordinated by six O atoms from two [(C4H2O6)2B]5− anions, while K(2) atoms are five-coordinated by five O atoms from two different {[Ni(PY)2]2·[(C4H2O6)2B]}− anions.

data.question: Which compound has a BO3CoO3 crown structure?
Is the half-wave potential of 1-CoB5/600 and 2-CoSB/450 both 0.83 V?
What method was used for the synthesis of compound 1?
Does compound 2 exhibit a new type of sulfate–borate with an unexpected Co–O–S bond?
What is the role of organically templated borates in catalysts based on compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: They expose more active sites, making their ORR activity better than that of non-templated ones.

data.question: Which compound has a structure that includes a BO4 tetrahedron and a BO3 triangle?
Is the electrocatalytic ORR activity of 3-based and 4-based catalysts weaker than that of 1-based and 2-based catalysts?
What is the crystal system of compound 3?
Does compound 4 contain a {[Ni(PY)2]2·[(C4H2O6)2B]}− anion?
What is the significance of the supramolecular skeletons of 1 and 2?
data.answer: They provide sufficient space and porosity, crucial for electrocatalytic ORR activity.

data.question: Which compound was synthesized using a solution evaporation method?
Is the band gap of compound 1 approximately 5.14 eV?
What is the formula weight of compound 3?
Does the structure of compound 4 include a BO4 group and two tartaric acid anions forming a [(C4H2O6)2B]5− anion?
